divs: Sighting DetailsThe image sticks in mind to this day from that night over 10 years ago. Being twenty years old now, I remember in vivid detail where I was, where I was going, who I was with and what I saw in the sky that night. While late in driving to my step-father's mothers house for What I remember to be a Christmas dinner, I was with my mother as we drove through the dark highway going toward Oxford. As we were riding I remember nagging my mother as most eight-year olds do, until we saw what appeared to be a reflection in the sky. The moon, placed at it's particular angle of night, happened to shimmer off what appeared to be a wide, triangular shape pointed by three stars. As I looked to my mother, who had been anxiously chewing a piece of gum in place of her cigarette, I noticed she was looking the same direction in the sky I was at the time. It was at that point, the reflection was clearly that of some sort of CRAFT, which then disappeared in a single glance. Together, my mother and I stopped what we were doing. I asked, "What was that Mommy?", and her reply was, "I dunno son." I remember a slight fear, being replied by a boost of adrenaline as to the possibilities of what I saw that night. To this day, I remember the craft I saw that night. What it was, I dunno. I was eight-years-old and I know kids have an imagination... but when such a thing causes my mother to stop chewing her gum to keep quiet during my child-hood rants, it was definatly something. My mother will no longer acknowledge what we did infact see that night... but I know, and I know SHE knows... if anyone else saw it, I'm not to say. But what happened that night did happen, and I promise you it was not of this world.
